verses.verse: "Man, <S%H120><s%> who is born <S%H3205><s%> of woman, <S%H802><s%> Is short-lived and full <S%H7649><s%> of turmoil. <S%H7267><s%>
"Like a flower <S%H6731><s%> he comes <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> and withers. <S%H9268><s%> He also flees <S%H1272><s%> like a shadow <S%H6738><s%> and does not remain. <S%H5975><s%>
"Thou also <S%H637><s%> dost open <S%H6491><s%> Thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> on him, And bring <S%H935><s%> him into judgment <S%H4941><s%> with Thyself.
"Who <S%H4310><s%> can make <S%H5414><s%> the clean <S%H2889><s%> out of the unclean <S%H2931><s%>? No <S%H3808><s%> one! <S%H259><s%>

"Since <S%H518><s%> his days <S%H3117><s%> are determined, <S%H2782><s%> The number <S%H4557><s%> of his months <S%H2320><s%> is with Thee, And his limits <S%H2706><s%> Thou hast set <S%H6213><s%> so that he cannot <S%H3808><s%> pass. <S%H5674><s%>
"Turn <S%H8159><s%> Thy gaze <S%H8159><s%> from him that he may rest, <S%H2308><s%> Until <S%H5704><s%> he fulfills <S%H7521><s%> his day <S%H3117><s%> like a hired <S%H7916><s%> man. <S%H7916><s%>

"For there <S%H3426><s%> is hope <S%H8615><s%> for a tree, <S%H6086><s%> When <S%H518><s%> it is cut <S%H3772><s%> down, <S%H3772><s%> that it will sprout <S%H2498><s%> again, <S%H5750><s%> And its shoots <S%H3127><s%> will not fail. <S%H2308><s%>

"Though <S%H518><s%> its roots <S%H8328><s%> grow <S%H2204><s%> old <S%H2204><s%> in the ground, <S%H776><s%> And its stump <S%H1503><s%> dies <S%H4191><s%> in the dry <S%H6083><s%> soil, <S%H6083><s%>
At the scent <S%H7381><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%> it will flourish <S%H6524><s%> And put <S%H6213><s%> forth <S%H6213><s%> sprigs <S%H9524><s%> like <S%H3644><s%> a plant. <S%H5194><s%>
"But man <S%H1397><s%> dies <S%H4191><s%> and lies <S%H2522><s%> prostrate. <S%H2522><s%> Man <S%H120><s%> expires, <S%H1478><s%> and where <S%H335><s%> is he?
"[As] water <S%H4325><s%> evaporates <S%H235><s%> from the sea, <S%H3220><s%> And a river <S%H5104><s%> becomes <S%H9162><s%> parched <S%H9162><s%> and dried <S%H3001><s%> up,

So man <S%H376><s%> lies <S%H7901><s%> down <S%H7901><s%> and does not rise. <S%H6965><s%> Until <S%H5704><s%> the heavens <S%H8064><s%> be no <S%H1115><s%> more, <S%H1115><s%> He will not awake <S%H9516><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> be aroused <S%H5782><s%> out of his sleep. <S%H8142><s%>

"Oh <S%H4310><s%> <S%H5414><s%> that Thou wouldst hide <S%H6845><s%> me in Sheol, <S%H7585><s%> That Thou wouldst conceal <S%H5641><s%> me until <S%H5704><s%> Thy wrath <S%H639><s%> returns <S%H7725><s%> [to Thee,] That Thou wouldst set <S%H7896><s%> a limit <S%H2706><s%> for me and remember <S%H2142><s%> me!

"If <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H1397><s%> dies, <S%H4191><s%> will he live <S%H2421><s%> [again?] All <S%H3605><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of my struggle <S%H6635><s%> I will wait, <S%H3176><s%> Until <S%H5704><s%> my change <S%H2487><s%> comes. <S%H935><s%>
"Thou wilt call, <S%H7121><s%> and I will answer <S%H6030><s%> Thee; Thou wilt long <S%H3700><s%> for the work <S%H4639><s%> of Thy hands. <S%H3027><s%>
"For now <S%H6258><s%> Thou dost number <S%H5608><s%> my steps, <S%H6806><s%> Thou dost not observe <S%H8104><s%> my sin. <S%H9128><s%>
"My transgression <S%H6588><s%> is sealed <S%H2856><s%> up in a bag, <S%H6872><s%> And Thou dost wrap <S%H2950><s%> up my iniquity. <S%H5771><s%>
"But the falling <S%H5307><s%> mountain <S%H2022><s%> crumbles <S%H5034><s%> away, <S%H5034><s%> And the rock <S%H6697><s%> moves <S%H6275><s%> from its place; <S%H4725><s%>

Water <S%H4325><s%> wears <S%H7833><s%> away <S%H7833><s%> stones, <S%H68><s%> Its torrents <S%H9372><s%> wash <S%H7857><s%> away <S%H7857><s%> the dust <S%H6083><s%> of the earth; <S%H776><s%> So Thou dost destroy man's hope. <S%H6><s%>
"Thou dost forever <S%H5331><s%> overpower <S%H8630><s%> him and he departs; <S%H1980><s%> [Thou] dost change <S%H8132><s%> his appearance <S%H6440><s%> and send <S%H7971><s%> him away. <S%H7971><s%>

"His sons <S%H1121><s%> achieve <S%H3513><s%> honor, <S%H3513><s%> but he does not know <S%H3045><s%> [it;] Or they become <S%H6819><s%> insignificant, <S%H6819><s%> but he does not perceive <S%H995><s%> it.
"But his body <S%H1320><s%> pains <S%H3510><s%> him, And he mourns <S%H56><s%> only for himself. <S%H5315><s%>"
